decks.notes: The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent while quickly deploying threats to apply pressure. With cards like Cabal Therapy, Spell Pierce, Force of Will, Daze, and Wasteland, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. The deck also includes card draw spells like Ponder, Gitaxian Probe, and Brainstorm to find the necessary cards. The creatures in the deck, such as Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, Gurmag Angler, Vendilion Clique, and Deathrite Shaman, provide multiple angles of attack and can quickly close out the game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, while also having disruptive elements like Dismember and Warping Wail to handle threats. The mana base is optimized for efficiency, with a mix of lands like Ancient Tomb and Wasteland to support the Eldrazi creatures' colorless casting costs.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to deal 10 points of infect damage to the opponent and win the game. By utilizing creatures such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf with pump spells like Berserk and Invigorate, the deck aims to bypass traditional life totals and instead focus on poison counters. With a combination of mana acceleration and protection spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to respond.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using efficient and disruptive spells to control the game while deploying aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler to close out the game quickly. The deck includes disruption like Daze, Force of Will, and Cabal Therapy to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having cards like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay for removal. The mana base includes dual lands and Wasteland to ensure consistency and disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan for a proactive and controlling strategy.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to overwhelm the opponent. It also disrupts the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere while using cards like Phyrexian Revoker to shut down key cards or abilities. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain board control with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. The mana base includes lands like Ancient Tomb and Cavern of Souls to help cast Eldrazi creatures efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as a resource to control the game, with a particular emphasis on the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to quickly generate a 20/20 Indestructible token. Support cards like Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam help facilitate this combo, while disruption tools like Wasteland and Rishadan Port disrupt opponents' mana bases. Molten Vortex provides additional removal, while Abrupt Decay deals with problematic permanents. The deck aims to grind out opponents with resource denial and overwhelming threats from the land base.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to maintain early pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while protecting them with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes a low mana curve and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and tempo advantage. Key cards like True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage offer additional threats and flexibility in different game states, allowing for a balanced mix of aggression and control in the aggressive play style.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through card manipulation and countering opponent's spells. The key strategy involves setting up powerful combinations of cards like Sensei's Divining Top with Counterbalance to control the top of the opponent's deck. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provide card advantage and versatility in spells. Terminus and Swords to Plowshares deal with threats on the board while also drawing cards with Monastery Mentor. The deck aims to outlast opponents by controlling the battlefield and gradually winning through incremental advantages.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly bring out low-cost, evasive infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, and then power them up with pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to deal lethal infect damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect your creatures and ensure your combo goes off smoothly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, allowing for efficient casting of spells and getting the right colors of mana.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck is designed to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, backed up by fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide. The mana base is also optimized to support the colorless Eldrazi creatures with lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple.addContainerGap

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple allow for quick access to mana, while cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Thought-Knot Seer help to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and quickly close out the game before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while using creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger to repeatedly cast spells and draw additional cards with Glimpse of Nature. The deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board presence and win the game by utilizing Natural Order to fetch Craterhoof Behemoth and overwhelm the opponent with a massive attack. The deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board state and utilizing combo interactions to win the game.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck is also designed to control the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base allows for versatile casting options with a combination of fetch lands and dual lands. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of the game using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Ensnaring Bridge. The combo aspect involves using Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire deck in one turn. The deck also includes powerful red cards like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect the combo and remove any threats. Overall, the strategy is to control the board and win the game through a quick and devastating combo finish.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble a critical mass of fast mana and cantrips in order to generate a large storm count and cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently through powerful combo turns that can overwhelm the opponent with a high storm count. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo and clear the way for a successful win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while using Terminus as a board wipe. The deck aims to control the opponent's plays using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of the library. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and other creatures like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage provide additional value and pressure. The deck also includes a small white splash for additional removal and sideboard options. Overall, the goal is to outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game.
